Description:
Atkins, now part of SNC-Lavalin, is the world’s largest provider of nuclear engineering and consultancy worldwide. Of the 38,000 staff we have globally, our nuclear and power team is 4,000 based across Canada, UK, USA and also the UAE.Our UAE team is the HQ of our nuclear and net zero energy work in the middle east region. We have been a trusted supplier of services to the UAE’s peaceful nuclear power programme since 2011, and we are instrumental in some of the net zero energy transition work across the region, including CCGT development, waste to energy plants, and green hydrogen.We are seeking to grow our local team of technical and project management professionals, who can work directly with our clients, delivery excellent quality work, and develop trusting relationships.We are a dynamic and growing team, and we have an extremely positive and friendly working environment.Responsibilities:Being a consultancy (and in a growing environment), the roles may vary but the short-term responsibilities will include:Working as part of an integrated team, dealing with technical requests coming from the customer

Balancing multiple projects and priorities

Working with the team to identify how we, as a company, can solve the technical problems, which may be reaching into our global pool of experts

Contributing technically to solutions, writing proposals, reports, and recommendations

Developing a network of trusted clients and further building relationshipsRequirements:Degree qualified in a related Engineering or material science (essential)

Written and spoken technical English (essential)

Strong communication skills

Willingness to flexibly and occasionally out of hours to accommodate project & client requirements.Rewards & Benefits:We offer an excellent package which includes:A competitive salary

Accommodation allowance

Transportation allowance

22 calendar days annual leave

Medical and life insurance cover

Company gratuity scheme

Discretionary bonus scheme

Annual flight allowance to point of origin

Employee Well-Being Programme – 24 hour free advice on financial, legal and family care specialists and also access to personal health, fitness and nutrition consultantsJob Details
